pr_title: (#19376): Adding method to add field variables when provided

timeline.message: Moving ContentType Resource collection file and adding tests to it

timeline.bodyText: is it worth to log the exception here?
timeline.author: nollymar

timeline.bodyText: I would add some ITs to this logic, it can be at factory or api level
timeline.author: nollymar

replies.bodyText: @nollymar This is already tested in the postman ContentTypeResourceTests.json test.
replies.author: victoralfaro-dotcms

replies.bodyText: It is ok to have the curl test, but they aren't meant to replace integration tests, especially when we have heavy logic in the API or Factory class
replies.author: nollymar

timeline.bodyText: It is worth a test over here
timeline.author: erickgonzalez
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -639,6 +638,18 @@ public void delete(final Field field, final User user) throws DotDataException,
 
   }
 
+    /**
+     * Given a field load and return its variables.
+     *

+     * @throws DotDataException when SQL error happens
+     */
+    @Override
+    public List<FieldVariable> loadVariables(final Field field) throws DotDataException {

timeline.bodyText:
Doc Test
/**
* Method to test: include this in case the method to test does not belong to the class this test-class is testing 
* Given Scenario: Scenario under test
* ExpectedResult: Expected result that the assertion is checking against

timeline.author: erickgonzalez

timeline.bodyText:
I am wondering if this code can not be move to the ContentTypeAPI after dbSaveUpdate, it woud be desire to avoid API call into a Factory objects.
If there is not possible, would be ok
timeline.author: jdotcms

replies.bodyText:
@jdotcms that call to FieldAPI was already there. Probably I formatted the code and that's why it looks like I added it.
The main change I've introduced is the saveFieldVariables() method.
